Yes, It can be tricky to avoid distractions during remote meetings, especially since everyone is working from home. Here are some tips:

1. Prioritize your space: Designate a specific room or space in your home where meetings can take place to minimise interruptions and distractions.

2. Shut out distractions: Turn off notifications on your phone or computer, close unnecessary tabs and applications, and put your phone on silent mode to minimise interruptions.

3. Utilize video cameras: Use video cameras during remote meetings to help keep everyone engaged and focused on the conversation.

4. Encourage active participation: Keep the meeting interactive and encourage active participation from everyone in the meeting to help minimize distractions.

5. Schedule breaks: Schedule breaks during longer meetings to help team members refresh and refocus, especially if the meeting is longer than an hour.

6. Set expectations: Set expectations for team members, such as keeping their cameras on, muting their microphones when they're not speaking or chat usage during the meeting.

Ultimately, remote meetings are only successful if everyone is focused and actively participating. By following these tips, team members can avoid distractions and keep the remote meeting productive and engaging.
